comments.raw_text:
This bug was introduced by the fix for bug 178895 in NSS 3.10,
lib/cryptohi/seckey.c, rev. 1.33. 

http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/nss/lib/cryptohi/seckey.c&rev=1.61&mark=785,797,805-806#784

The SECITEM_CopyItem call copies data to newparams.  Then, the
function reads newparams.data[0] without checking if the
SECITEM_CopyItem call succeeded.
comments.creator: wtc@google.com
comments.author: wtc@google.com

This bug was introduced by the fix for bug 178895 in NSS 3.10,
lib/cryptohi/seckey.c, rev. 1.33. 

http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/nss/lib/cryptohi/seckey.c&rev=1.61&mark=785,797,805-806#784

The SECITEM_CopyItem call copies data to newparams.  Then, the
function reads newparams.data[0] without checking if the
SECITEM_CopyItem call succeeded.
